title: Church Attendance
question_text:
Data from previous years show that approximately $47\%$ of residents in Chicago attend religious services at least once a month.
If multiple samples of the same size were chosen for this situation, which of the following would be the preferred center and spread of the sampling distribution?
solution:
Estimators must have low bias and low variability. Low bias in a sampling distribution is defined as the mean of the sampling distribution being equal to the true population mean. Low variability in this situation is based on a low standard deviation.

Choice 'D' is correct; it is the only solution that has no bias and also has the lowest variability since the standard deviation is only 4%.
